title: Add regions
comment:
Add regions to your c# files. Use #region <regionName> and #endregion to do this. Typically for a controller you will want 
 - init (initialize)
 - get
 - post
 - put
 - delete
 - helper methods

Just be careful regions are a good way to split up a class and make it readable, but if you end up with a large file with a ton of regions you may have a case where you need multiple files.

title: Add documentation
Will return empty list
comment: Good job on adding some error handling, but if your DB is empty this will return an empty list so you could handle that case as well.

title: Return types and parameters
comment: We should not use our Db Entities as return types or parameters because that is exposing out database structure to anyone who consumes the service. Instead we should create "Data Transfer Objects" or "DTO"s for those purposes.

title: use nameof()
comment: Instead of hard-coding a function name here, you can use nameof() to get the string name of a function. Then if the function name changes in a refactor, you don't need to update the code.\n\n

title: Good CreatedAtAction
comment: Good use of CreatedAtAction result!\n

title: A few endpoints to add
comment:
Good work overall, please take the comments from the Assigns controller and apply them here. 
There are a few endpoints you may want to add 
- get departments with the assign data
- check if department name is unique
- check if department abbreviation is unique
- check if the department has any assigns (you'd call this if someone was trying to delete a department, to confirm the assigns are gone)

title: Rename
comment: While devs will know what Post and Put are, it is typically prefered if you put Add and Update instead of Post and Put for your method/function naming.

title: Remove empty class
comment: Remove empty class

title: Add to Services Folder
comment: Should put the services in a services folder. Right now you have shared>services, this could live there. Same with department.service.ts and people.service.ts

title: Remove cosole.logs
comment: Unless you are logging something remove any of the console logs you have for testing. Or update them to "mock" logging such as console.log("Departments Loading") ... load departments ... console.log("Departments Loaded"). \nI would say for the sake of time remove them, but recognize the areas where you would want to log this sort of thing. We have a log service that does this on BP, I will show you.

title: Catch Error
comment: If this fails we should have some error handling that shows the user a toast with a message or some indication their action didn't work

title: Delete Department
comment: I should be able to delete a department. When I got to delete a department you'll want to add error handling so the user cannont delete departments that have people assigned to it. Best would be returning the list of people that are assigned and making the delete impossible.

title: Casing
comment: Should be onDepartmentAssignmentSaving, not ondepartment.... \nvery minor

title: Data duplication
comment: For a table like DepartmentAssignement we really only need AssignmentId, DepartmentId and PeopleId (and the audit fields). The rest of the information is already stored in the Department and People tables.

title: Allows duplicates
comment: There is nothing that stops me from adding the same person to a department mulitiple times. There should be some check and a error message of "This employee is already added to this department" or something of the sort. You can do this on the save click or with dx validation.

title: Successfull indication
comment: In some spots you are refreshing the data on a save which shows the updates which is great. It is important to signal to the user that their action was successful, you can also sow a success toast or other way to indicate it instead or as well as the refresh. \nAdd    this.toast.success('Sucess','Record Saved');

title: Documentation
comment: Please add documentation to all of the methods/functions. (not needed for the angular onInit or others)

title: Details for Folder Structure
comment:
This is our typical file structure 
1) components (for re-usable ui components, e.g. custom controls)
2) pages (which are components that are included in app-routing)
3) services (for all the service layer)
4) models (for all of the models and interfaces

title: Add Regjions
Display Name
comment: Email is a good choice for this, the alternative would be to create a DisplayName which would put the first and last name togther. Email is still good in alot of cases, but sometimes the email won't be easy to tie to the person(as in if my email was softwardev@pcl.com, you have no idea who I am) just so you know.

title: Refresh Clears Table
comment: Good idea on the refresh, it is clearing the grid at this point though. Your refresh is not resetting the data you could hook into that but instead for now lets just return a message so the user knows the save worked.

title: Error handling
comment:
What happens if this throws an error (e.g. if the API is not running)? How do you give the user appropriate feedback?

There's a great component from devextreme:

import {Notify} from devextreme/ui/notify;

Calling the notify() method lets you pop up a simple notification on the bottom of the screen. You can tell it if it is a success (default color green), a failure (default color red), or info (default color blue).

title: Hide Column
comment: The user doesn't need to see the Id field, same for the other pages you can hide this column

title: Shorter Region Name
comment: We can just call this Helper Methods, keeps it short concise, and if any code gets added later you won't have to update the name
